intro: Badilloa guantivana, commonly known as the Mexican goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its yellow flowers bloom in spring, and the plant produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by wind. Badilloa guantivana is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
